definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Bandy legs and fiddle front are objectionable.
sentences.chinese: 弯曲的前腿和提琴前腿都属于缺陷。

sentences.english: To remove the foreleg, cut through the hide and tendons AT the joint closest to the foot.
sentences.chinese: 除去前腿时要通过皮和筋在脚的关节处切下去。

sentences.english: Legs should be broad and flat, and good broad forearms and elbows are desirable.
sentences.chinese: 腿宽而平，前腿和肘部有足够的宽度是理想的。

sentences.english: Keep the center of your front heel aligned with your ipsilateral sitting bone.
sentences.chinese: 保持前腿跟的中心正对着你同一侧的坐骨。

sentences.english: When approaching, the forelegs form a continuation of the straight line of the front.
sentences.chinese: 当前进时，前腿形成了一个连续不断的直线。

sentences.english: Knuckling over of the front legs is a disqualification.
sentences.chinese: 前腿有突球是不合格的。

sentences.english: Forelegs, but a slip back a Gouchi Shi.
sentences.chinese: 可是前腿一打滑又来了一个狗吃屎。

sentences.english: The forelegs should be perfectly straight, strong and heavy in bone.
sentences.chinese: 前腿相当直，结实且骨量充足。

sentences.english: Dewclaws on forelegs may be removed.
Forelegs should move well forward, without too much lift.
sentences.chinese: 前腿向前运步良好，但抬得并不太高。

sentences.english: B:It's kangaroo, an interesting animal with short front legs.
sentences.chinese: 是袋鼠，很有意思的，前腿很短。

sentences.english: Chloe picks at the strands around its front legs.
sentences.chinese: 可儿开始剥离绕在蜥蜴前腿的丝线。

definition: to hunch over/to stoop/to arch one's back (upward)
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
